Its southernmost portion, known as Salento peninsula, has the shape of a high heel on the "boot" of Italy. == Geography == Apulia is in Southern Italy. It has an area of . There are 4,077,166 people living in the region, for a density of . The region is bordered by Molise to the northwest, Campania to the west, Basilicata to the southwest, the Strait of Otranto and the Ionian Sea to the southeast, the Gulf of Taranto to the south, and the Adriatic Sea to north and to the east. ==Provinces== The region is divided into six provinces: Province Abbreviation Area (km²) Population Density (inh./km²) Comuni Bari BA 41 Barletta-Andria-Trani BT 10 Brindisi BR 20 Foggia FG 61 Lecce LE 97 Taranto TA 29 ==Provinces== Castel del Monte BW 2016-10-14 12-26-11 r.jpg|Castel del Monte in Andria, symbol of the region Petruzzellibarioggi.jpg|Teatro Petruzzelli in Bari Ostuni.jpg|The medieval town of Ostuni ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website * Environmental League Puglia
